docs.title: Material for MkDocs
docs.text: Welcome to Material for MkDocs.

docs.title: SupermarketApp
docs.text: Template for create own shop app

docs.title: What is SupermarketApp?
docs.text: SupermarketApp is a template that you can use to create your own app for your shop. You need to understand that application in this template not use like SAP technology and products assortment provides by own database tables. You can associate your own database and do changes for app source code to support your DB.

docs.title: Everything you’d expect – and a little more
docs.text:
🚀 Local development

Application works with local SupaBase so it means that you have unlimited

📡 No Internet

All calculations are performed locally - no Internet needed. Complete autonomy, wherever you go.

🧠 Made for professionals

Calculations and interface are adapted to real cases of wind energy specialists. We consulted with experts to ensure there is nothing superfluous.

🔧 Constant development

WeC is a living project. We are actively developing functionality, listening to users and preparing new useful tools.

docs.title: Who is WeC suitable for?
docs.text:
• Renewable energy engineers
  • Researchers and students
  • Wind turbine designers and developers
  • Anyone who is passionate about wind energy

docs.title: Development
docs.text: We believe in building great software together. If you're a developer passionate about clean code, smart UX, or performance optimization — we’d love your help!

docs.title: 🛠️ How You Can Contribute
docs.text:
• 🐞 Fix bugs or report new issues
  • 🌟 Suggest and implement new features
  • 🚀 Improve performance or scalability
  • 🌍 Help with localization and translations
  • 📚 Enhance documentation and tutorials

docs.title: 🤝 Why Join?
docs.text:
• ✅ Collaborate with an open and friendly team
  • 🧠 Learn by contributing to a real-world project
  • 📈 Grow your portfolio and skills
  • ✨ Get credit in release notes and docs

docs.title: 🚀 Get Started
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository: https://github.com/bondarukid/SupermarketApp/fork
  2. Read the Contributing Guide and Code of Conduct
  3. Pick an open issue or propose your own
  4. Open a pull request when ready!

We welcome contributions from developers of all levels. Let's build something great — together. 💙

Got questions? Reach out via Discussions or open an issue!

docs.title: 🚀 Join Our Team
docs.text: We’re building an open, user-friendly, and high-quality product — and we’re looking for passionate contributors to join us on this journey!

docs.title: 🔹 iOS Developers (Swift / SwiftUI)
docs.text:
• Help build and architect the iOS app
  • Work with APIs, local data storage, and animations
  • Optimize performance and improve user experience

docs.title: 🔹 UI/UX Designers
docs.text:
• Design clean and intuitive user interfaces
  • Create mockups, prototypes, animations, and visual styles
  • Assist with documentation visuals, branding, and component guides

docs.title: 🔹 Technical Writers & Documentation Contributors
docs.text:
• Maintain and expand our documentation (in English and optionally other languages)
  • Write usage guides, API docs, changelogs, and tutorials
  • Organize and structure content using MkDocs (Material theme)

docs.title: 🔹 Web Developers (optional)
docs.text:
• Help build or maintain the documentation site (MkDocs, GitHub Pages, etc.)
  • Assist with versioning, structure, and front-end polish

docs.title: 💙 Why Join?
docs.text:
• 🌍 Remote-first, flexible schedule
  • ✨ Influence real decisions and architecture
  • 📚 Grow through collaboration and open-source contributions
  • 🧾 Get credited in releases, docs, and on the website
  • 🛠️ Work with modern technologies: SwiftUI, Supabase, MkDocs Material

docs.title: ✅ How to Get Involved
docs.text:
1. Reach out via email: [your@email.com] or open an issue on GitHub
  2. Introduce yourself and let us know what you’d like to work on
  3. We’ll guide you through getting started!

Whether you’re a seasoned developer, an aspiring designer, or a documentation pro — if you care about building something great, we’d love to collaborate with you.

Let’s build it together. 💫

docs.title: Project Strcuture
docs.text: Contains everything about user information and info about list of favorite products, delivery options and etc.

docs.title: Models
docs.text:
Located in Models/. Represent the data layer of the app.

  • UserModel.swift — stores user data
  • AllergensModel.swift — describes a product

docs.title: User
docs.text:
Located in User/. Represent the data layer of the app.

  • ProfileView.swift — profile page
  • UserDetailsView.swift — page that contains user details
  • UserNameChangeView.swift — page that provide for user to change him name
  • UserPhoneChangeView.swift — page that provide for user to change phone number

docs.title: User Model
docs.text:
Code below show you a model of user that used for user details.

struct UserModel: Codable {
    let id: UUID
    let firstName: String
    let middleName: String
    let lastName: String
    let phone: String
    let points: Int
    let birthday: Date

    enum CodingKeys: String, CodingKey {
        case id
        case firstName = "first_name"
        case middleName = "middle_name"
        case lastName = "last_name"
        case phone
        case points
        case birthday
    }
}

Enum in code below used for supabase coding:

enum CodingKeys: String, CodingKey {
    case id
    case firstName = "first_name"
    case middleName = "middle_name"
    case lastName = "last_name"
    case phone
    case points
    case birthday
}

All variables names that used in model needs to be same in table columns, but not all variables we can create with same name so we need to provide coding key - how variable in model looks like in table column.

Pay attention to provide right variables declaration

If your variable name not much like in table column you must to provide codingkey.
